N1: Bivši student prorektor tvrdi da mu je nudjen novac da glasa da doktorat ministra nije plagijat

06 Nov 2019, 12:05

Doskorašnji student prorektor Beogradskog univerziteta Danilo Potparić, koji je i član Odbora za profesionalnu etiku, rekao je da mu je jedan delegat Studentskog parlamenta nudio novac u zamenu da glasa da doktorat ministra finansija Siniše Malog nije plagijat.U izjavi za televiziju N1, Potparić je rekao da je taj delegat kasnije rekao da je u pitanju šala i dodao da, za sada, ne želi da oktriva ko je to bio."Pre nekoliko meseci nudili su mogućnost finansijskog benefita za mene ako bih podržao neku opciju, koja je u svim akademskim načelima prosto nemoguća. Ja ću u tom slučaju postupati u skladu sa kodeksom profesionalne etike Univerziteta i moralnim načelima. Svaka trgovina ne dolazi u obzir", kazao je Potparić.Upitan da li to znači da mu je nudjen novac kako bi glasao za to da sporni doktorat nije plagijat, sagovornik N1 kaže da mu je novac nudio jedan od delegata u Studentskom parlamentu Univerziteta."Nudio mi je sumu novca da podelimo, kaže. Kada sam odbio, rekao je da je to šala i da on to nikada ne bi uradio", objašnjava Potparić.On kaže da drugih nepristojnih ponuda nije imao, a da li je nešto nudjeno drugim članovima Odbora za profesionalnu etiku imali, kaže da ne zna.Potparić u utorak nije reizabran na funkciju studenta prodekana Beogradskog univerziteta, već je na to mesto došao drugi kandidat.

N1: Former student vice-rector claims he was offered money to vote for a minister's doctorate as a plagiarism

06 Nov 2019, 11:05

Former student, Belgrade University Vice-Rector Danilo Potparic, who is also a member of the Professional Ethics Committee, said that a student Parliament delegate offered him money in exchange for voting that Finance Minister Sinisa Mali did not plagiarize. In a statement to N1 television, Potparic said that that delegate later said it was a joke and added that, for now, he did not want to ooze who it was. "A few months ago, they offered the possibility of a financial benefit to me if I supported an option, which in all academic principles it is simply impossible. In that case, I will act in accordance with the University's code of professional ethics and moral principles. Every trade is out of the question, "Potparić said. Asked if that means he was offered money to vote for the controversial doctorate is not plagiarized, N1 interlocutor says he was offered money by one of the delegates in the University Student Parliament. "He offered me a sum of money to share, he says. When I refused, he said is that it was a joke and he would never do it, "Potparić explains. He says he did not have any other indecent offers, and if he had something offered to other members of the Professional Ethics Committee, he does not know. re-elected as Vice-Dean of Belgrade University, another candidate has already arrived.
